newsitem.title: JAPAN: Pioneer Electronic to take over karaoke firm.
newsitem.headline: Pioneer Electronic to take over karaoke firm.

text.p: Pioneer Electronic Corp said on Thursday that it plans to acquire JHC Corp, a firm which markets karaoke equipment, in a bid to strengthen its on-line karaoke business.

JHC filed for "composition with creditors" under Japanese bankruptcy laws in August 1996 with total debts of about 20 billion yen. This is a procedure under which a trustee is appointed to supervise an ailing company but the debtor retains control over its assets.
After the court rules on JHC's request to pursue such proceedings, Pioneer plans to buy a stake of nearly 100 percent in the karaoke firm through a third-party allotment, a Pioneer spokesman said.
JHC plans to issue about 300 million yen worth of new shares through the third-party allotment, the spokesman said.
